abstract: Citigroup said Monday that first-quarter net income fell 11 percent, hurt by a charge related to its plans to eliminate 17,000 jobs and slash costs. But profit excluding special items topped analysts’ forecasts, helped by surging trading gains, including 20 percent revenue gains from fixed-income capital markets and 26 percent from equity markets.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup said Monday that first-quarter net income fell 11 percent, hurt by a charge related to its plans to eliminate 17,000 jobs and slash costs. But profit excluding special items topped analysts’ forecasts, helped by surging trading gains, including 20 percent revenue gains from fixed-income capital markets and 26 percent from equity markets.
